|stockos = Linux;4.4.14; |exp_if_types = USB 3.0, USB 2.0 / eSATA (combo port) |exp_usb_num = 2 |exp_esata_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 6-pin header |jtag = yes,, 20-pad header |specialfeat = |flags = Wave2, MU-MIMO, VHT160, AP3200, DFS |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Wistron NeWeb |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, Gargoyle, OpenWrt, |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 06/12/2017 |estreldate = 01/03/2017 |reldate = |estprice = 330 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = N82E16833124643 |asin = B072LQZFHM |asin_country = CA |asin2 = B079XSHN1F |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 245.9 x 193.8 x 51.8 mm |weight = 798.32 g |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Marvell;88W8964; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 4 |rad1rxchains = 4 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam1 = 600 |rad1n = 450 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Marvell;88W8964; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam2 = 2600 |rad2ac = 1300 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Added to the FCC entry for the [[Linksys WRT3200ACM]] :via [https://fccid.io/Q87-WRT3200ACM#Grant-TCB-5 Class II Permissive Change on 6/12/2017]. C2PC: - Adding a new model name: Linksys WRT32X :- Changing the firmware for the new model :- Changing the enclosure color for the new model ;This device has 20/40/80/160 MHz bandwidth modes. ===Specifications=== *CPU: [[Marvell]] 88F6820-A0 C180 @1.8 GHz ([https://www.marvell.com/embedded-processors/armada/armada-38x/ Armada 385]) *Flash: 256MB (NAND), RAM: 512MB (DDR3) *WLAN: 2x [[Marvell]] [http://www.marvell.com/wireless/avastar/88W8964/ 88W8964] 4T4R 802.11abgn/ac (MU-MIMO) *Switch: [[Marvell]] [http://www.marvell.com/switching/link-street/ 88E6352] (7-Port AVB GbE Switch, 5x GbE PHY) *PSU: 12V/3A; LED: [https://www.linksys.com/us/support-article?articleNum=247434 ''Status light behavior''] *Dimensions: 245.9 x 193.8 x 51.8 mm (w/o antennas) *Weight: 798.32 g (28.16 oz) ==Links of Interest== :[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/userguide/WRT32X%20-%20User%20Guide%20(International).pdf User Guide]
[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/license/FW_License_WRT32X_v1.0.180404.58.pdf Open Source licences] ===Wikis=== *[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt_ac_series ''Linksys WRT AC Series'' the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] :[https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt_ac_series#wrt32x WRT32X] - [[Marvell]] Armada 385 @1.8GHz (Venom) ===Reviews=== *[http://www.tweaktown.com/reviews/8313/linksys-wrt32x-ac3200-wireless-gaming-router-review/index.html ''Linksys WRT32X AC3200 Wireless Gaming Router'' on '''TweakTown'''] *[https://www.windowscentral.com/linksys-wrt32x-review ''Linksys WRT32X Wi-Fi router review'' on '''WindowsCentral'''] ===News=== *[https://www.snbforums.com/threads/linksys-re-launches-wrt32x-gaming-router.40807/ ''Linksys Re-launches WRT32X Gaming router'' on '''SNB''' forums] *[http://www.killernetworking.com/technology/killer-prioritization-engine ''Killer Prioritization Engine - Linksys WRT32X'' on '''KillerNetworking'''] *[http://www.anandtech.com/show/10956/linksys-wrt32x-gaming-router-announced-with-killer-prioritization-engine-from-rivet-networks ''Linksys WRT32X Announced'' on '''AnandTech'''] :CPU [[Marvell]] ARMADA 38x @1.8GHz Dual-Core ARM (Cortex A9) :256MB Flash and 512MB of DDR3 Memory :Dual-Band AC3200 (N600 + AC2600) 3x3 radio (2.4/5GHz) :''Tri-Stream 160'' radio belong to the [[Marvell]] Avastar 88W8964 :4x high-performance antennas and high-powered PAs for better range :5-port SOHO-grade Gigabit Ethernet switch with TCAM (1x WAN, 4x LAN) :USB 3.0, USB 2.0 and eSATA ports for NAS-like network storage :MU-MIMO Technology for Airtime efficiency, QoS engine powered by Killer Networking :Exclusive optimization for Killer Networking gaming clients in MSI, Alienware, Razer :DFS certified for operation in the clear DFS channel airspace :Custom-built firmware specially tuned for online gaming traffic ===Third party firmware information=== *[https://forum.openwrt.org/t/davidc502-wrt1200ac-wrt1900acx-wrt3200acm-wrt32x-builds/15839 ''OpenWrt community builds'' on '''OpenWrt''' forums] :OpenWrt build target: mvebu :DD-WRT build target: linksys-wrt32x *[https://github.com/kaloz/mwlwifi/ ''Wi-Fi open source driver'': '''mwlwifi'''] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = wrt32x build 33413 20170927 :[https://forum.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT1900AC Install Guide] :[https://forum.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewforum.php?f=58/ ''DD-WRT build discussion'' on '''DD-WRT''' forums] Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/linksys/linksys_wrt32x_v1_venom |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrt32x |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/t/divested-wrt-no-nonsense-hardened-builds-for-linksys-wrt-series/80522 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = mvebu |subtarget = cortexa9 |arch = arm_cortex-a9_vfpv3 |support_started_version = 18.06.0 |current_supported_version = 23.05.4 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial===
